channel.title: Is this considered a java memory leak?
channel.description:
[img]http://img51.imageshack.us/img51/7344/sdgsfgd.png[/img]
Its not that major of a leak though, is it, if it is one? Because ive seen things FAR worse than this.

item.title: Is this considered a java memory leak?
item.dc:creator: @sp11k3t3ht3rd sp11k3t3ht3rd
item.source: Is this considered a java memory leak?

item.title: Is this considered a java memory leak?
item.dc:creator: @Ghost_in_stack Ghost in stack
item.description:
@Ghost_in_stack wrote:

Confused, the Java virtual machine(JVM) have a garbage collector and it should collect and free all unreferenced memory automatically.

Read full topic
item.source: Is this considered a java memory leak?

item.title: Is this considered a java memory leak?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

It depends. If your int[] objects aren’t being used, and yet are not being collected by the garbage collector, then it’s a memory leak. If it uses those int[]s still, but there are just a lot of them (hence taking up a lot of memory) then it’s not a memory leak.

Read full topic
item.source: Is this considered a java memory leak?

item.title: Is this considered a java memory leak?
item.dc:creator: @filthjr filthjr
item.description:
@filthjr wrote:

12 mb in memory is abnormal?

how large is the data on every object in the game

Read full topic
item.source: Is this considered a java memory leak?

item.title: Is this considered a java memory leak?
item.dc:creator: @Kaex Kaex
item.description:
@Kaex wrote:

[quote=“filthjr, post:4, topic:385792”][quote author=Kaex link=topic=481546.msg3526510#msg3526510 date=1299871894]

It’s not that bad.

You didn’t answer him?

Technical terms yes it is. Because the bytes are taking up its memory.
[/quote]

you don’t know what you’re talking about

@OP you can’t tell if your program has a memory leak just by an image of how much memory has been allocated[/quote]

But you can question if it does if its abnormal.

Read full topic
item.source: Is this considered a java memory leak?
